item.title: Eulerian Video Magnification
item.description: Introduction Human visual perception can be extremely limited compared to the rest of the animal kingdom. We don’t see the entire color spectrum and we can hardly perceive tiny movements thus missing potentially important information from our environment. In 2012, Hao-Yu Wu and his team pusblished the paper Eulerian Video Magnification for Revealing Subtle Changes in the World containing a method that allows us to amplify colors and motions from a simple video to help us visualize imperceptible changes from the world around us.
